Description: Pottery jar, stamnos-like but without handles, small disk base, globular body with straight, slightly expanding neck with slightly thickened, rounded rim offset by slight groove; groove on shoulder; micaceous red Nile silt clay. Mended.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Philadelphia register card records '227' as the findspot of this piece in Naukratis. There are no scratched numbers on the piece itself.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.132)
